channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-1363] .mat files not parsing
item.description:
We recently committed a parser for Matlab .mat files, however I've just downloaded the most recent Tika and am not getting any parsed --text or --metadata for the .mat file used in the unit test. The steps I've used are below. Am I missing something at the command line? Can anyone else successfully get a text or metadata output for a .mat file?

Steps:

svn co https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tika/trunk tika
setenv MAVEN_OPTS "-Xms128m -Xmx256m"
cd tika
mvn install

java -jar tika-app/target/tika-app-1.6-SNAPSHOT.jar --text /Users/IGSWAHWSWBURGESS/Development/tika/tika-parsers/src/test/resources/test-documents/breidamerkurjokull_radar_profiles_2009.mat

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
For issues like these (where it could be a problem with your environment, etc) it's best to first post to the mailing list, and then (after researching the issue) if it really looks like a bug, you can create a Jira issue. Also you'll get more visibility and likely better response from the mailing list.

Having said that, I tried it myself, and I do get (minimal) metadata - the Content-Type is application/x-matlab-data, but there's no text.

Hi Annie,

Can you attach a small file with the same issue (no text)? Then, hopefully, we can refine MatParser to get some more detail.

Tyler

Hi Tyler,

Attached is a very simple .mat file.

Annie
I don't have Matlab on this computer. So, unfortunately, I can't open the file right now. What're the contents (i.e. the source code in the file)? Is there more than just a double:[2x2 double array]?

That is it. Very simple, so the text output should be just as you said,
double: [2x2 double array]

On Wed, Jul 9, 2014 at 9:49 AM, Tyler Palsulich (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

–
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Ann Bryant Burgess, PhD

Postdoctoral Fellow
Computer Science Department
University of Southern California

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Great! The patch in TIKA-1327 will take care of this issue. I'll update the patch there with this new file and and a corresponding test case.

Ken Krugler I asked Ann Burgess to file this issue - I figured it's inexpensive to file and close one, and better to get things into the system. dev@tika.a.o would have been fine too.

Thanks for filing the patch Tyler Palsulich I will look at it now!

Just pulled most recent tika and I'm still not getting text from the Matlab
parser:
$ svn co http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tika/trunk tika
$ mvn install
$ java -jar tika-app/target/tika-app-1.6-SNAPSHOT.jar --text
/Users/IGSWAHWSWBURGESS/Development/tika/tika-parsers/src/test/resources/test-documents/test_mat_text.mat
$

It does seem like the mime-type is recognized:

$ java -classpath
annie-parsers.jar:tika-app/target/tika-app-1.6-SNAPSHOT.jar
org.apache.tika.cli.TikaCLI --detect
/Users/IGSWAHWSWBURGESS/Development/tika/tika-parsers/src/test/resources/test-documents/breidamerkurjokull_radar_profiles_2009.mat
$ application/x-matlab-data

Tyler, did you integrate the patch and get -t and -m output? Want to make
sure I'm not missing a step.

On Mon, Jul 14, 2014 at 1:16 PM, Chris A. Mattmann (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

–
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Ann Bryant Burgess, PhD

Postdoctoral Fellow
Computer Science Department
University of Southern California
Viterbi School of Engineering
Los Angeles, CA

Alaska Science Center/USGS
Anchorage, AK

Cell: (585) 738-7549
Office: (907) 786-7059
Fax: (907) 786-7150
E-mail: anniebryant.burgess@gmail.com
Office Address: 4210 University Dr., Anchorage, AK 99508-4626
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tyler P. and I determined the tika parser was not registered in META-INF. This was determined after I changed the unit test to AutoDetectParser, and the test failed. This patch updates the unit test and adds the MatParser to the org.apache.tika.parser.Parser file.

• great job Annie and Tyler: committed the patch below:
[mattmann-0420740:~/src/tika] mattmann% svn commit -m "updated patch for TIKA-1363 from Annie Burgess: enables Mat parser in META-INF and fixes unit test to use AutoDetectParser to validate it."
Sending        tika-parsers/src/main/resources/META-INF/services/org.apache.tika.parser.Parser
Sending        tika-parsers/src/test/java/org/apache/tika/parser/mat/MatParserTest.java
Transmitting file data ..
Committed revision 1610600.
[mattmann-0420740:~/src/tika] mattmann%

SUCCESS: Integrated in tika-trunk-jdk1.7 #94 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/tika-trunk-jdk1.7/94/)
updated patch for TIKA-1363 from Annie Burgess: enables Mat parser in META-INF and fixes unit test to use AutoDetectParser to validate it. (mattmann: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/tika/trunk/?view=rev&rev=1610600)

  • /tika/trunk/tika-parsers/src/test/java/org/apache/tika/parser/mat/MatParserTest.java

SUCCESS: Integrated in tika-trunk-jdk1.6 #93 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/tika-trunk-jdk1.6/93/)

  • /tika/trunk/tika-parsers/src/main/resources/META-INF/services/org.apache.tika.parser.Parser
